runs.comm: bit of outswing from a good length outside off. He's opened his bat face and steered it down to third man.
outswing again, and bounce as well. Simmons doesn't get forward but pokes at it and his outside edge is beaten.
onto the pads this time and Sodhi fields this flick at short fine leg
outswing from wide outside off, left alone
onto the pads, and he's tucked it neatly, very fine, to the right of short fine leg and it races away for four
off-and-middle this time and he gets a thick outside edge down to third man as he looked to defend. It swung away very late.
short and wide, and he slashes hard but gets nowhere near making contact
bit of shape into the right-hander, towards off stump, and he defends off the back foot. It's started drizzling, I think
length ball, nice tight line just outside off, and he defends this into the off side
back of a length, on off, and he pushes it into the off side off the back foot
width this time, and he waits on it and plays a controlled slash down towards third man

big appeal, and it's given! He was coming forward to that, but the ball swung in late and he ended up pad-batting it towards mid-off. It was hitting him in line with middle, fairly low down on the front pad
back of a length, and he defends down the pitch
it was angling in and there wasn't enough room to cut, and he's beaten by the extra bounce
short, and he's pulled it down towards deep midwicket. Didn't quite time that. Watling's fielding down there.
angled in towards off, moves away a touch, and he gets across and pokes it down to mid-on with a bit of wrist-work

got him! Watling takes a comfortable chest-high catch on the deep midwicket boundary after Smith pulled this short ball uppishly and straight at the fielder. He had to fetch it from a fair distance outside off stump
length ball on off stump, defended off the front foot
drifts onto the hips, and he tucks it away past square leg to get off the mark
angled across, starting a fair distance outside off, and he presses forward before deciding to let go
bit of inswing, maybe? He didn't really come forward to that as he looked to drive through cover, and got a thick inside edge that trickled towards square leg
angled across, back of a length, and he lets it go outside off
lovely-looking shot. It's full, outside off, and he gets a good stride in to drive this to wide mid-off. The groundstaff are ready on the edge of the boundary with the covers.

slashed! that was short and he got a lot of bat-speed into this uppercut, which flew over the head of third man as he came in off the rope. May have misjudged the flight of the ball, but I don't think he would have got near it even if he had stayed on the edge of the rope
shortish ball, tucking up the batsman. Comes across and works it off his hip towards short fine leg
angled across and full. Little too wide for the drive, and Bravo leaves this
elegant looking drive, on the up, but mid off cuts it off easily, sliding to his right, as it slows down on this heavy-looking outfield
onto the pads, and he tucks it unobtrusively down to short fine leg
shortish ball, doesn't really come on, and he pulls this off his hip to deep midwicket, getting his front leg off the ground as he does so
length ball on off stump, and he's nicely forward to defend
resumes with a wide slanted way down the leg side
comes in a touch off the seam, from back of a length, and it sneaks between Bravo and his inside edge as he looked to defend that off the back foot
on to the pads this time and he tucks it away towards midwicket
shortish ball, not too much width, and he's punched that off the back foot into the covers
another backfoot punch, slightly fuller delivery, and he's hit it uppishly but it bounces down safely towards mid-off
back of a length ball, on the hips, and they think of a single after Fletcher tucks it into the leg side but decide against it

how casual was that? that was a perfectly good ball, angled across the right-hander, and quite a way outside off. He takes a step forward and across and simply picks it up and sends it soaring over the long-on boundary
onto the pads, and he works it wide of long-on, far enough to his left for the batsmen to run two
short ball, and that sat up and gave Bravo loads of time to pull that stylishly to deep midwicket
slower ball, full and on off stump. Fletcher waits for it and defends back to the bowler
another slower ball, and he flicks it this time, towards midwicket
full ball, on off stump, driven straight to cover
short ball, angling across, so far across that Bravo - who is shaping for the cut, initially, realises he can't get anywhere near it and pulls away from the stroke. Called wide
Flat-bats this drive hard to mid-off, where McCullum dives to his right to make a good stop
starts with a slower ball, on a good length, angled towards off, and he has to wait for it to come on and defend back to the bowler
down the pitch and tries to go over extra cover, but gets a thickish edge down to third man
another slower ball, and he looks to be shaping to drive through the off side but gets an inside edge that runs away towards midwicket
short ball, well down the leg side, and it's called wide after Fletcher shapes to pull and decides in the end to let it go
short again, and he pulls this from around hip-height towards deep square leg
back of a length, rising up towards the hips, and he gets on his toes to tuck it towards square leg
another slower ball, outside off this time, and he waits on it and opens his bat face to dab it down to third man
and Bravo's launched his first ball mercilessly over long on. It was tossed up right into the slot, on off stump, and he cleared his front leg and swung cleanly through the line
short now, and he rocks back to cut this hard to deep cover
short again, rubbish ball, but he snatched too eagerly at this pull and was too early into the shot, which went bouncing down towards long-on
full ball outside off, and he aims a big drive at it but gets an inside edge that nearly bounces onto the stumps before he went back and booted the ball away
quickish ball on the stumps, back of a length, and he tries to force it down the ground with a lot of bottom-hand but hits it back to the bowler
back of a length, outside off, and he plays a controlled cut past point
slower ball, full and on middle stump, and he gets a thickish inside edge down towards deep square leg as he tries to play this through the off side
another slower ball, and he opens his face and runs this down to third man
backs away to give himself room and slap this straightish length ball to deep cover
bangs this in, and Bravo ducks under the tennis-ball bounce
short, wide, and Bravo misses out, aiming an elaborate slash at the ball but making no contact
that's a horrific delivery, way outside off and nearly yorking the wicketkeeper as he gets his gloves down to collect it on the full
that was flighted, on off stump, and he clears his front pad and slogs it hard over the bowler's head
lovely response, turns away sharply after drawing the batsman forward and beating his outside edge
fullish ball, tucked into the leg side
another brutal hit back over the bowler's head. Again the front pad goes out of the way and again he swings hard and free through the line
onto the pads now and it's flicked down towards deep midwicket. Ran the first run aggressively and deep backward square leg had to run a long way to his left, so an easy two
fired in full, on off stump, and he drives it hard but straight to cover
down the leg side, and it would have been a wide had Bravo not been trying to make himself room. Tries to tuck it off his hips and it goes off towards fine leg off his thigh pad
slower ball outside off, and Fletcher slashes hard at it and misses. Inches outside the tram line and it's called wide
another slower ball, and he's deposited that slash straight into cover's hands, but Southee has overstepped. Quite clearly too, replays suggest
bangs this in, and he looks to pull but is late on the ball and it goes off his shoulder down towards backward point
slower ball outside off, and he mistimes a big heave that goes rolling down towards long-on
short ball again, and Bravo is late on another pull. Goes down towards the bowler off his edge
another short ball, and this time he manages to get the pull to go in the intended direction, towards deep midwicket, but he hasn't really timed that either
another slower ball wide outside off, way outside off this time, and Fletcher has let this go
slower ball, on the stumps this time, and he's flicked that towards deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, and he's slogged that, not very convincingly, down to deep midwicket
and that's disappeared miles over cow corner. That was full, on off stump, and it's the most agricultural heave you will see in a very long time but he's hit that incredibly cleanly
wow. That's another big heave across the line. It was on middle stump this time, and he's hit it much squarer, over deep square leg this time
he didn't really get hold of this one, and it goes bouncing down over a desperately backtracking cover fielder. It was full, and wide of off, and he heaved hard at it once again
dropped! full again, and he's smashed that hard, straight back to the bowler, who gets his fingers to it but can't hold on to the catch. It simply didn't stick

the short ball has done the trick for New Zealand. Bravo has looked distinctly uncomfortable against it, and this was properly banged in. He tried to pull, and was in no position to do so, since it was shoulder-high, and he sent this top-edge steepling behind the wicket, where Ronchi doesn't have to move too much to take the catch
slower ball outside off, and Fletcher gets to his second half-century in this format with an open-faced dab down to third man
that's the slower bouncer, and it's signalled wide as Pollard aims a speculative tennis-smash at it and gets nowhere near connecting
walks down the pitch and works this off-stump ball down to deep backward square leg
full, well outside off, and he's flicked it attractively and timed it very well but straight down to deep midwicket
shortish, wide, and he's too early into that attempted cut and he's hit it down towards mid-off
slower ball outside off and he's slogged across the line and sent it running down towards deep midwicket. Didn't get hold of it at all

got him! It's flat and quick, on off stump, and it spins sharply away and takes his outside edge as he rocks back and tries to club it over the leg side. Ball loops up to short third man, who has the simplest of catches to take
turn, and it beats Pollard as he pushes out uncertainly outside off stump
goes for the big drive over long-off, but doesn't time it well enough and it drops down to the fielder, on the bounce
shortish ball, and he goes deep in his crease and cuts it to point
tossed up high, and Sammy hits that cleanly over extra cover. Huge wind-up, massive follow-through, and it bounces down past the boundary
short, and punished. Smashed hard and long over deep square leg after he took a big step back into his crease
bangs this short, and it slides well down the leg side
full-toss at a comfortable knee height, and he only had to help that (this is Pollard, after all) over the deep midwicket boundary with the shortest of follow-throughs
onto the pads now, full, and he works it into the leg side

short, and it surprised him for pace, and he was halfway between pulling and swaying out of the way and the ball looped up off the shoulder of his bat down to short third man. Excellent delivery, saw Sammy clear his front leg in a premeditated manner
back of a length, and he half-pulls, half tucks it away off his hips down towards midwicket
length ball, angled towards off stump, and he defends this off the back foot. The bowler runs forward at the end of his follow-through to remove any intention of sneaking a single
slower ball outside off, and Russell flashes at it but is too early into his shot and it bounces down towards the keeper
shortish slower ball, and he clubs this down towards mid-off, where McCullum pulls off a nonchalant one-handed pick-up and throw
slogs at this and misses completely. It was another slower ball, and he didn't really have his eye on the ball as he swung his entire body into that shot
banged in, and Russell ducks under it. He might not have needed to, since it was way over head height

angled across, and he's slapped it to mid-off, where McCullum again picks up and throws in one blurry motion and gets a direct hit at the bowler's end. They've gone to the third umpire, but he's home and dry
short ball, and he's a little late on that pull but gets it away towards deep midwicket
angled across, and Russell, backing away, tries to go over extra cover but ends up slicing it high in the air and the sweeper runs to his left and takes a simple catch on the boundary
full, outside off, and he drives it hard to mid-off
short ball, and he's pulled it to the left of deep backward square leg
short again, and he's throws his weight into that pull but hasn't connected. Top hand comes off the bat handle, in that familiar Pollard manner
slower bouncer this time, and Pollard can't connect with another pull. The ball loops over his head and Ronchi fumbles after the ball bounces down in front of him
another attempted pull, another swat at thin air. Southee's mixing up his pace beautifully here

taken! Another short ball, and Pollard connects this time but not very well, and he swats this uppishly towards deep midwicket. Anderson runs to his right and dives sideways to take it low, close to the ground, with both hands.

slower ball, and Ramdin had no idea where that was going, before he sees it late, dipping down towards the blockhole. He swats at it and hits it down towards mid-on. Neesham sprints in from long-on and throws to the keeper's end, where Ronchi takes off the bails as Ramdin looks for a non-existent second to boost West Indies' total. This has been a superb last over from Southee
